lead_paragraph: Pieces that washed up could be part of the wreckage from Flight 370, which vanished almost exactly two years ago, Malaysian officials reported.

byline.contributor: Michelle Innis and Charles Mangwiro contributed reporting.

headline.print_headline: New Debris May Belong to Airliner Lost in ’14
headline.main: Debris in Mozambique Is Thought to Come From Malaysia Airlines Plane

snippet: Pieces that washed up could be part of the wreckage from Flight 370, which vanished almost exactly two years ago, Malaysian officials reported.
abstract: Malaysian authorities say debris found washed up on coast of Mozambique could be from Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, missing since March 2014; finding, along with earlier one on French island of Reunion, bolster speculation plane crashed in southern Indian Ocean.
